task_summary: Robot arm visually locates a mug, approaches above it, aligns, pours from a spout into the mug, then retracts.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robot arm executing a pour action into a mug placed on a flat surface. The mug is white and initially stationary with the pouring implement (red, likely a spout or bottle) starting away, then moving closer and aligned above the mug. The robot must perceive the mug, approach from above, align, perform a controlled pour at a 90-degree tilt, and then retreat. No obstructions or lids are present. There are no explicit grasp actions; the episode begins with the spout already in the end effector.
preconditions: Mug is present and visible on the table
Pouring device (spout/bottle) is grasped by the robot
No obstruction above or inside the mug
stepwise_plan: Tilt and pour a full amount into the mug
success_criteria: Liquid is poured inside the mug
No spillage or collision with mug
failure_and_recovery: If mug not detected: retry scan 3 times
If pour not completed: time out and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Robot retreats after pour, episode ends

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug is visible to the vision system.
Attempts to visually scan for the mug using raster pattern, up to 3 times.
Locates and estimates pose of the mug.
Moves the end effector above the mug with a 10cm vertical offset.
Fine approach and center alignment of spout directly over the mug, with 5mm tolerance.
Pours from spout into mug with a 90-degree tilt, amount full.
Withdraws pouring tool away from the mug by 10cm.

recovery_strategy: Retry mug scan up to 3 times
Abort action and retreat if alignment/pour unsuccessful
assumptions: The episode does not show explicit object grasping but the red spout is used as the pour source; assumed already secured.
No explicit liquid detection â€” pour action denotes act of tilting/actuation.
Instruction requests 'pour in mug'; frames confirm only one pour target, so 'full' amount and 'normal' rate chosen.
Target name 'spout' inferred from red tool; no bottle/box/pitcher specified.

expected_success_criteria: Pouring action completes and tool is retracted.
